newsitem.title: USA: S.F. stadium passes by narrow margin - final count.
newsitem.headline: S.F. stadium passes by narrow margin - final count.

text.p: Voters in San Francisco narrowly approved a $525 million football-mall complex, according to final election results released Tuesday.
Voters passed Proposition D, which authorizes the sale of up of $100 million of bonds, with 50.4 percent support. There were 87,567 ayes against 86,045 nays.

Voters also backed Proposition F by 50.3 percent, agreeing to waive zoning restrictions to speed construction of the stadium for the San Francisco 49ers football team. There were 87,102 yes votes versus 85,902 no votes.
Formal certification of the June 3 vote was expected by Friday, city election officials said.
